{{Infobox comedian | name = Colin Jost | image = Colin Jost at Citi Field, 2015.jpg | image_size = | caption = Jost at [[Citi Field]] in 2015 | birth_name = Colin Kelly Jost | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|6|29|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Staten Island]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[Harvard University]] | medium = {{hlist|[[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]]|[[television]]|[[film]]}} | genre = {{hlist|[[Political satire|Political]]/[[news satire]]|[[observational comedy]]|[[sketch comedy]]|[[blue comedy]]|[[insult comedy]]|[[surreal humor]]}} | subject = {{hlist|[[Mass media]]/[[news media]]/[[media studies|media criticism]]|[[politics of the United States|American politics]]|[[American culture]]|[[current events]]|[[popular culture|pop culture]]}} | active = 2005–present }} '''Colin Kelly Jost'''{{cite journal |url=https://archive.org/stream/brownalumnimonth838brow/brownalumnimonth838brow_djvu.txt |title=The Classes | first1= Peter |last1=Mandel |first2= Cynthia|last2= Baher |date=May 1983|volume= 83|issue=8|page=58 |work=Brown Alumni Monthly |accessdate=September 13, 2014|quote=Darnel A. Jost and his wife. Dr. Kerry Kelly '77 M.D., of Staten Island, N.Y., report the birth of their first child, Colin Kelly Jost, on June 29.}} ({{IPAc-en|dʒ|oʊ|s|t|}}, born June 29, 1982){{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/colin-jost/642068/|title=Colin Jost|publisher=[[TV Guide]]|archivedate=January 29, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129003814/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/colin-jost/642068/}} is an American comedian, actor, and writer. He is known for his work on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', where he has served as a writer since 2005 and "[[Weekend Update]]" co-anchor since 2014. He also served as one of the show's co-head writers from 2012 to 2015, and it was announced that he would come back as one of the show’s head writers in December 2017.{{cite web |last=Johnson |first=Ben |url=http://www.silive.com/entertainment/tvfilm/index.ssf/2008/10/profile_colin_jost.html |title=Cover Story: Jost for Laughs |work=AWE |date=October 30, 2008}}{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/entertainment/snl-head-writer-join-cecily-strong-weekend-update-co-anchor-2D1198195 |title='SNL' head writer to join Cecily Strong as 'Weekend Update' co-anchor|first=Gael Fashingbauer|last=Cooper|work=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|The Today Show]]|date=January 23, 2014|accessdate=January 23, 2014}}{{cite web|last1=Abramovitch|first1=Seth|title=Colin Jost Steps Down as Head Writer at 'Saturday Night Live'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/colin-jost-steps-down-as-833276|website=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 21, 2015}}http://deadline.com/2017/12/saturday-night-live-colin-jost-michael-che-co-head-writers-of-nbc-series-1202225574/ ==Early life== Colin Jost was born and raised on [[Staten Island]], New York.Fretts, Bruce (April 7, 2014). "Surely You Jost!". ''[[TV Guide]]''. p. 9.Zaino, Nick A. III (July 25, 2013). [https://www.bostonglobe.com/arts/theater-art/2013/07/25/colin-jost-from-harvard-lampoon-saturday-night-live/N0T8TsJ7ZIXqsGtQPBhHEJ/story.html "Colin Jost, from Harvard Lampoon to 'SNL'"]. ''[[The Boston Globe]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.vulture.com/2014/01/meet-colin-jost-saturday-night-liveweekend-update-new-co-anchor.html |title=Meet Colin Jost, SNL's New 'Weekend Update' Co-Anchor |last=Fox |first=Jesse David |publisher=Vulture |date=January 23, 2014 |accessdate=September 13, 2014}} He has one brother, Casey Jost, who had a role in ''[[Staten Island Summer]]'' and is a writer for ''[[Impractical Jokers]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/colin-jost-michael-che-25-things-you-dont-know-about-us-w442445|title=Colin Jost and Michael Che: 25 Things You Don’t Know About Us|access-date=2016-10-03}} His mother, Kerry J. Kelly, was the chief medical officerhttps://nypost.com/2018/03/16/fdny-head-medical-officer-retires-in-thelma-and-louise-style/ for the [[New York City Fire Department]] and a physician on Staten Island, and his father, Daniel A. Jost, is an engineer and former teacher at [[Staten Island Technical High School]].Friedman, Milly (February 24, 2014). [http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/snl-ready-jost-update-article-1.1628506 " 'Saturday Night Live' moves young comic Colin Jost into a 'Weekend Update' anchor chair"]. ''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]'' (New York).Bailey, Rob (March 1, 2014). [http://www.silive.com/entertainment/tvfilm/index.ssf/2014/03/staten_island_native_colin_jos_1.html "Staten Island native Colin Jost to make 'Weekend Update' debut on March 1's 'Saturday Night Live'"]. [[silive.com]]. Jost was raised [[Roman Catholic]]. He attended [[Regis High School (New York City)|Regis High School]] in Manhattan, where he was the editor of the school newspaper, ''The Owl'', and [[Harvard University]], where he was president of the ''[[Harvard Lampoon]]''.Ramisetti, Kirthana (January 23, 2014). [http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/colin-jost-ro-replace-seth-meyers-snl-article-1.1589290 "Colin Jost to replace Seth Meyers as 'Weekend Update' cohost on 'Saturday Night Live'"]. ''Daily News'' (New York). ==Career== While at Harvard, Jost won $5,250 on a college edition of ''[[Weakest Link (U.S. game show)|Weakest Link]]''. Shortly after graduating from Harvard, he was hired as a writer at [[National Broadcasting Company|NBC]]'s ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' (''SNL'') in 2005 at 22 years old. From 2009 to 2012 Jost was ''SNL'''s writing supervisor. He was co-head writer from 2012 to 2015 and regained that status in late 2017.https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/12/colin-jost-michael-che-head-writers-saturday-night-live He often collaborates with fellow ''SNL'' co-head writer Rob Klein.{{cite web |last=Gallagher |first=Brian |url=http://www.movieweb.com/news/tracy-morgan-set-for-id-theft |title=Tracy Morgan Set for ID Theft |publisher=MovieWeb |date=March 5, 2010}} During the summer hiatus following the 2012-13 season, executive producer [[Lorne Michaels]] asked Jost if he could do the "[[Weekend Update]]" feature, as co-anchor [[Seth Meyers]] would soon be leaving to host ''[[Late Night With Seth Meyers]]''. Jost accepted and replaced Meyers on the March 1, 2014, episode.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/snl-names-new-weekend-update-673533 |title='SNL' Names New 'Weekend Update' Co-Anchor |first=Lesley |last=Goldberg |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=January 23, 2014 |accessdate=January 23, 2014}} Jost names [[Norm Macdonald]] as a primary influence for his "Update" anchor work, as Macdonald's tone was the one Jost grew up with in high school. He also names [[Tina Fey]] as an influence. In addition to ''Weekend Update'', Jost made a brief cameo appearance as [[Ohio]] [[Governor]] [[John Kasich]] in a [[Republicanism in the United States|Republican]] presidential debate sketch.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/cast/colin-jost-14796/impersonation/john-kasich-210801|title=Watch John Kasich Sketches From SNL Played By Colin Jost - NBC.com|website=NBC|access-date=2016-07-02}} As a stand-up comedian, Jost has appeared on ''[[Late Night With Jimmy Fallon]]'' as well as on [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] and [[HBO]].{{cite web|last=Cavin|first=Cory|url=http://www.latenightwithjimmyfallon.com/blogs/2011/01/check-out-comedian-colin-jost-tonight/|title=Check Out Comedian Colin Jost Tonight!|work=[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]|date=January 28, 2011}} He was selected as a "New Face" at the [[Montréal]] ''[[Just for Laughs]]'' festival in 2009,{{cite web |last=Gadino |first=Dylan P. |url=http://www.laughspin.com/2010/07/16/just-for-laughs-feimster-lawrence-jost-impress-at-new-faces/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130426110556/http://www.laughspin.com/2010/07/16/just-for-laughs-feimster-lawrence-jost-impress-at-new-faces/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=April 26, 2013 |title=Just For Laughs: Feimster, Lawrence, Jost impress at New Faces |publisher=LaughSpin |date=July 16, 2010 }} and has since appeared several times at the [[Chicago]] ''[[Just for Laughs]]'' festival (2011 and 2012) and the Montréal festival (2010 and 2012). Jost has published three "Shouts and Murmurs" pieces in ''[[The New Yorker]]'' magazine, in addition to writing for ''[[The New York Times Magazine]]'', ''[[The Huffington Post]]'', ''[[The Staten Island Advance]]'' and ''[[Radar (magazine)|Radar]]''.{{cite web |last=Jost |first=Colin |url=http://www.newyorker.com/humor/2011/04/04/110404sh_shouts_jost |title=Explaining Your Time Warner Bill |work=[[The New Yorker]] |date=April 4, 2011}} Jost wrote the screenplay of and played a minor role in the 2015 comedy film ''[[Staten Island Summer]]''. He also had a minor role as Paul in the 2016 [[romcom]] feature ''[[How to Be Single]]''.{{Cite news |url=http://www.silive.com/entertainment/tvfilm/index.ssf/2016/01/watch_colin_jost_dump_alison_b.html |title=Watch Colin Jost dump Alison Brie in 'How to be Single' trailer}} ==Personal life== It was confirmed in December 2017 that Jost had begun a relationship with actress [[Scarlett Johansson]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/scarlett-johansson-colin-jost-red-carpet-photos_us_5a21787be4b0a02abe90d1ee|title=Introducing ScarJost: Scarlett Johansson And Colin Jost Go Public|last=Sieczkowski|first=Cavan|date=2017-12-01|work=Huffington Post|access-date=2018-05-20|language=en-US}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Film ! Role !
